title: How to Do a Wheelie in Need for Speed: ProStreet

steps.headline: Use a RWD car with very high HP, I recommend the Shelby GT500 (the one that costs 42,000).
Install all level 3 parts the lower the aero the better 2 max, And add some N20.
steps.description: Stage 4 parts are not a must, but can make doing a longer wheelie easier. Make sure you set your rear suspensions to soft and the front suspensions to stiff.the lower the aerial the better 2 max

steps.headline: Get a score of good or better.
steps.description: Of course, max grip is the best but not a must. If you're going to break your record I would recommend getting max grip, again, for those few extra ft.

steps.headline: Feel the rhythm of the orange lights so you can predict the green light.
steps.description: It works like a charm. Launch

steps.headline: Use N20 when your front wheels start coming back down (this will be around the 3rd gear).

text: Use a RWD car with very high HP, I recommend the Shelby GT500 (the one that costs 42,000).  Install all level 3 parts the lower the aero the better 2 max, And add some N20. Stage 4 parts are not a must, but can make doing a longer wheelie easier. Make sure you set your rear suspensions to soft and the front suspensions to stiff.the lower the aerial the better 2 max Go to the drag race.  Warm up your tires. Green marks the optimal rpm. Get a score of good or better. Of course, max grip is the best but not a must. If you're going to break your record I would recommend getting max grip, again, for those few extra ft. Feel the rhythm of the orange lights so you can predict the green light. It works like a charm. Launch Use N20 when your front wheels start coming back down (this will be around the 3rd gear).
